00032 #include "config_dap.h"

00034 static char rcsid[] not_used =
00035     { "$Id$" };
00036 
00037 #include <signal.h>
00038 
00039 #ifndef WIN32
00040 #include <unistd.h>
00041 #endif
00042 #ifdef HAVE_PTHREAD_H
00043 #include <pthread.h>
00044 #endif
00045 
00046 #include "SignalHandler.h"
00047 
00048 EventHandler *SignalHandler::d_signal_handlers[NSIG];
00049 SignalHandler *SignalHandler::d_instance = 0;
00050 // This variable (instance_control) is used to ensure that in a MT
00051 // environment _instance is correctly initialized.
00052 #if HAVE_PTHREAD_H
00053 static pthread_once_t instance_control = PTHREAD_ONCE_INIT;
00054 #endif
00055 
00056 void
00057 initialize_signal_handler()
00058 {
00059     // MT-Safe if called via pthread_once or similar
00060     SignalHandler::d_instance = new SignalHandler;
00061 }
00062 
00069 void 
00070 SignalHandler::dispatcher(int signum)
00071 {
00072     // Perform a sanity check...
00073     if (SignalHandler::d_signal_handlers[signum] != 0)
00074     // Dispatch the handler's hook method.
00075     SignalHandler::d_signal_handlers[signum]->handle_signal(signum);
00076 }
00077 
00079 SignalHandler* 
00080 SignalHandler::instance()
00081 {
00082 #if HAVE_PTHREAD_H
00083     pthread_once(&instance_control, initialize_signal_handler);
00084 #else
00085     if (!d_instance)
00086     initialize_signal_handler();
00087 #endif
00088 
00089     return d_instance;
00090 }
00091 
00096 EventHandler *
00097 SignalHandler::register_handler(int signum, EventHandler *eh) 
00098     throw(InternalErr)
00099 {
00100     // Save the old EventHandler
00101     EventHandler *old_eh = SignalHandler::d_signal_handlers[signum];
00102 
00103     SignalHandler::d_signal_handlers[signum] = eh;
00104  
00105     // Register the dispatcher to handle this signal. See Stevens, Advanced
00106     // Programming in the UNIX Environment, p.298.
00107     struct sigaction sa;
00108     sa.sa_handler = dispatcher;
00109     sigemptyset(&sa.sa_mask);
00110     sa.sa_flags = 0;
00111 
00112     // Try to suppress restarting system calls if we're handling an alarm.
00113     // This lets alarms block I/O calls that would normally restart. 07/18/03
00114     // jhrg
00115     if (signum == SIGALRM) {
00116 #ifdef SA_INTERUPT
00117     sa.sa_flags |= SA_INTERUPT;
00118 #endif
00119     }
00120     else {
00121 #ifdef SA_RESTART
00122     sa.sa_flags |= SA_RESTART;
00123 #endif
00124     }
00125 
00126     if (sigaction(signum, &sa, 0) < 0)
00127     throw InternalErr(__FILE__, __LINE__, "Could not register a signal handler.");
00128 
00129     return old_eh;
00130 }
00131 
00135 EventHandler *
00136 SignalHandler::remove_handler(int signum)
00137 {
00138     EventHandler *old_eh = SignalHandler::d_signal_handlers[signum];
00139 
00140     SignalHandler::d_signal_handlers[signum] = 0;
00141 
00142     return old_eh;
00143 }
